author: mattdbr

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body: Hi **@akkatracker**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution! This seems like a small (but important) contribution, so no Contribution License Agreement is required at this point. Real humans will now evaluate your PR. TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: mattdbr
comments.body: Fair enough. Is this autogenerated by code in the Powershell Repo? If so is there any way to fix it?

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
> //  <auto-generated>
> //      This code was generated by a tool. DO NOT EDIT
> //
> //      Changes to this file may cause incorrect behavior and will be lost if
> //      the code is regenerated.
> //  </auto-generated>
> // -----------------------------------------------------------------------

@lzybkr @KrishnaV-MSFT @daviwil @SteveL-MSFT does anyone know how the *.Generated.cs files were generated? History in source depot shows those files haven't been changed for more than 7 years. If we are not going to re-generate them in future, maybe we should remove the confusing comments.

comments.author: daviwil
comments.body: I think this code might have been generated in the past but its contents look hand-edited judging from the commits I see.  Not sure why the "DO NOT EDIT" comment was left in.  Seems like it's fine to accept this change to fix the comment!

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: Issue #2141 was opened to track the obsolete comments.

title: its to it's where appropriate in MessageTextBox.Generated.cs
